conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to determine the maximum distance between Car A and Car B.
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t = 10 s to t = 30 s.
Car B accelerates uniformly from t = 0 s to t = 30 s.
Position of a car can be found by calculating the area under the v-t graph.
For Car A, from t = 0 s to t = 10 s, distance covered is 0.
For Car A, from t = 10 s to t = 30 s, distance covered is 800 m.
For Car B, distance covered is 600 m.
At t = 30 s, both cars are side by side.
At t = 10 s, Car A has covered 0 m and Car B has covered 200 m.
The maximum distance occurs when the difference in their positions is greatest.
From t = 10 s to t = 30 s, Car A moves 800 m and Car B covers an additional 400 m.
The difference in distance is 400 m.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B is 400 meters.
